bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 161, Number 7 (Wednesday, January 14, 2015)]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. YOUNG of Alaska:H.R. 392.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3[Page H408]

item.title: A bill to resolve title issues involving real property and equipment acquired using funds provided under the Alaska Kiln Drying Grant Program.

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Agriculture, Nutrition, and Forestry.

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.
Referred to the House Committee on Agriculture.

summary.text: Vests title to real property and equipment acquired using funds provided under the Alaska Kiln Drying Grant Program in the grant recipient in accordance with the compensation provisions in this Act.

bill.title: To resolve title issues involving real property and equipment acquired using funds provided under the Alaska Kiln Drying Grant Program.

item.title: To resolve title issues involving real property and equipment acquired using funds provided under the Alaska Kiln Drying Grant Program.
To resolve title issues involving real property and equipment acquired using funds provided under the Alaska Kiln Drying Grant Program.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Conservation and Forestry.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
